intro: Hydrosme angolensis, commonly known as the Angola hydrosme, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes grass-like plants and some aquatic species. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, adapting to environments with high humidity and standing water. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is relatively rare and found only in limited geographic areas.
